Hey team, *@U0381SKQVJ5* needs support! :goodchop_fan:Please check the details.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

*Priority:* Medium :large_yellow_circle: 
*Topic:* Bug Report


:mag: *Issue reported:*
Images are not loading on staging env


:footprints: *Steps to reproduce:*
Open the staging env on Vercel and try to load any image over there: https://staging-vercel.goodchop.com/my-deliveries/2025-W30


as far as I could see it’s missing the image into the path: https://img.hellofresh.com/w_384,q_auto,f_auto,c_limit,fl_lossy/hellofresh_s3/

Not sure if this is related, but I checked this API request here: https://gw.staging-k8s.hellofresh.io/my-deliveries/menu?delivery-option=MR-3-0800-2000-4WEEKLY&postcode=10713&preference=default&product-sku=MR-CBT1-6-1-0&servings=1&subscription=307548&week=2025-W30&include-future-feedback=true&customerPlanId=982224e0-c0b3-4a64-ad10-8535d3c6357f&country=MR&locale=en-US and the image property is empty

The menus disappeared on ccm staging :open_mouth:
@UEZ4PRFKM maybe this could be related to the update you mentioned in retro a few minutes ago. could you tell us the POC that helped you with that so we can ask for a check?
maybe https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C0947G8PU82 is related

Yes this is likely related. This channel https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C0947G8PU82/p1751546625731909 is where we are discussing it. They made some changes but this specifically seems to be a related follow-up issue that they are currently working on
cool, let’s keep an eye then. maybe it’s just a matter of time. also, live is safe! :big-relief:
the recipes are back :tada:
Thanks folks, for all the context and explanation about the issue!

@U027201FQSV @U07VDFEFBQU i cloned the ticket to our board https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-2963

i’ll let the prioritisation for you guys - just remember that yesterday this triggered an incident. it was short and solved itself, but still… we might need have a somewhat nice priority for this one :+1:

btw i was thinking about adding this to the next sprint but we don’t have the next sprint’s group in our jira board… only  the current one

can we please invest some time to clean and organise that up a little bit? we could:

• always have a next sprint group to quickly add stuff in there (we used to have them)
• assess if we still need the following groups: Delection ROs and Cancellation S-Box. if they’re irrelevant and/or outdated, we can remove them
• check the backlog group and assess what we can remove/move from there. there are some old stuff in there, https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-748
thanks! :pray:
yes we usually have the next sprint board, forgot to create it this time. Just created one
also added the ticket to next sprint
I think we need to update service desk notifications  and removed tags as Val is no longer in the company and Vini is another team.

Hey! @U03EN3N4KM4 and I were looking into this problem as part of our chapter day, it sounded interesting, and we learned a lot.

We think we solved the issue and added a comment to the Service Desk ticket. We will wait for confirmation from the client.

thread_replies.text:
Thanks for the report! We will get back to you as soon as possible :blobthumbsup:

Meanwhile, please check our https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TNV/pages/4049372305/How+tos. It might help you speed up the process depending on the type of the request.
Hi Desi, looking at it :eyes:

@U7SJ525DE The change payment method functionality works fine. I have tested change to another credit card and to PayPal :white_check_mark:

One UX issue is when a customer changes to PayPal UI doesn't reflect the change correctly until the page refresh.

@U027201FQSV yea, we already tested the functionality a couple months ago with your team and this case specifically wouldn't happen on live because the payment token takes a bit to refresh (you'd see a 'we're updating your payment method' message instead).
I'm not making any logic/UI changes in my PR, just rolling out and updating the E2E
Thanks for details! Approved :white_check_mark:

Meanwhile, please check our https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TNV/pages/4049372305/How+tos. It might help you speed up the process depending on the type of the request.

This is a CSV with all subscriptions, week, the error from MSS and the selection they made
It seems like indexes 368 and 369 are the ones missing
In total you have 47 affected subscriptions and the weeks with wrong menus are 2025-W38 and 2025-W40

What Good Chop needs to check:
• Confirm that these are the indexes missing in the menus for the mentioned weeks
• Why are they missing? Is that a menu misconfig?
• After that’s done, the selection should be retried (we can do that work)

messages.text:
Hey team, *@U01U67XD681* needs support! :goodchop_fan:Please check the details.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

*Priority:* Low :large_green_circle: 
*Topic:* Other, General Support Request


:mag: *Issue reported:*
Hey team, got a question on how you guys handle triggering meal selection for customers that reactivate? If you could explain the flow/point me to the code I'd be super gr8ful :praycat:


:footprints: *Steps to reproduce:*
/////
messages.raw_text:
Hey team, *<@U01U67XD681>* needs support! :goodchop_fan:Please check the details.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

*Priority:* Low :large_green_circle: 
*Topic:* Other, General Support Request


:mag: *Issue reported:*
Hey team, got a question on how you guys handle triggering meal selection for customers that reactivate? If you could explain the flow/point me to the code I'd be super gr8ful :praycat:


:footprints: *Steps to reproduce:*
/////

thread_replies.text:
Thanks for the report! We will get back to you as soon as possible :blobthumbsup:

Meanwhile, please check our https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TNV/pages/4049372305/How+tos. It might help you speed up the process depending on the type of the request.
Hi @U01U67XD681, i’m not very familiar with the flow, but i will ask my team and we will get back to you
thank you, appreciate it :praycat: :blobheart:

hey suzi, what do you mean by handle triggering meal selection that reactivate exactly?

currently when customer reactivate it we send them to the dashboard with the same meal selection they had before (if they keep at the same plan)

we’re using the same codebase from the other brands, one of the parent components would be this ReactivationContent https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/pages/settings/src/components/Reactivation/ReactivationContent.tsx

i see that TPT doesn’t have a reactivation page. customers reactivate it right away from the dashboard with a CTA click. are you trying to get context around adding a reactivation page or something else? just to better understand how we can support you :)

I'm trying to understand how you handle the propagation of meal selection for customers that reactivate their accounts. The flow currently is user creates a subscription and selects their meals, meal selection is propagated to the last week menu thats available on CCM, lets say W45. What happens when that user deactivates their account and reactivates past W45 to a week where their previous meal selection hasn't been propagated to so no selection is done for that week, lets say W47 - do you handle this case by triggering meal selection so that its propagated to the rest of the weeks?

Hey all, we have synced with @U01U67XD681 in the office and clarified the question :white_check_mark:

Summary: We don't have any user flow during the reactivation, when we allow customers to select meals before they reactivate.
• If they still have recurring selection (via CRS) available in menu, we keep it
• If not, they are getting a default selection
yes thanks @U027201FQSV - will check with VMS to see how they're handling this scenario if at all and as discussed will report back with my findings :saluting_face:
@U018UCEFJ65 /resolve

Circling back - VMS didn't cover this flow however it would be easier for them to come up with a solution since VMS users' SKU is actually the source of truth for which meal selection the user has made so they can just trigger a save request whenever the user reactivates. But for TPT and GoC we have no way of telling what the selection was and will be given the default selection. I'll discuss w the team on possible solutions (most likely prompting the user to make a meal selection upon reactivation)

and something else I thought of, even if the user reactivates and their delivery still has the correct selection e.g. for W45, we still need to trigger meal selection so that the propagation can cover for the future weeks where the selection was not propagated to, for example lets say a users' meal selection is saved for all weeks up until W46 > user deactivates their account > user reactivates their account on W45 so they have their selection saved for W45 + W46 however for week W47 the selection will be lost so no matter what we need to trigger a meal selection for all users that reactivate to make sure that all weeks have the correct selection
